p: The current COVID-19 pandemic is threatening to bring world health systems on the brink of near collapse. There is a worldwide shortage of personal protective equipment for health workersÂ [ 27] of whom, more than 90,000 have been infected with the SARS-CoV-2 virus globally [ 27]. In the face of a relentless pandemic, weak health systems and inadequate supplies of personal protective equipment, Africa finds herself in a dire situation. Yet experience from previous infectious disease epidemics should have taught African governments of the need to invest and build their health systems with an emphasis on disease surveillance and careful healthcare planning and financing [ 28]. Some countries have started manufacturing their own personal protective equipment such as masks and gowns as demonstrated by Kenya [ 29].
